title: The impact of electronic word of mouth towards customers repurchase intention with e-trust and e-loyalty as the mediator in Indonesian ride hailing industry: a case of Gojek
abstract: Go-Jek (written as Gojek) is a multiservice and digital payment platform founded by Nadiem Makarim, an Indonesian citizen who studies at Harvard University and co-founded by Michaelangelo Moran 2010. Go-Jek is the first ‘Decacorn’ company in Indonesia. Regardless of its notoriety for a lot of uncertainty as a new business, Go-Jek has a constant growth in its total yearly service used. Although it is known that in a service industry, Word of Mouth is crucial to motivate customers to repurchase the service, customers seem to react otherwise in the case of Go-Jek. Therefore, this study aims to determine the impact of Electronic Word of Mouth towards repurchase intention with e-Loyalty and e-Trust as the mediator.
contributors: Maria Natalia Damayanti Maer, S.S., M.A., Ph.D. (Advisor 1); Adelina Proboyo (Examination Committee 1); Juliana Caesaria Tandung (Examination Committee 2)
